greeting.heading: Hello, World!
greeting.description: I make things for iOS and the Web.

intro.heading: "You know, I'm something of a scientist myself."
intro.description: My passion is experimenting with technologies to create software that is both functional and easy to use. Many of my efforts, which were originally intended to address personal issues, have later proven useful to family members and netizens around the world. It's incredibly rewarding to know that I'm making a positive impact beyond my own needs!

skills.heading: Skills
skills.description: I've always enjoyed exploring and experimenting with a wide range of technologies. My strength is in my ability to quickly grasp new concepts and adapt to different programming languages, tools, and platforms. This flexibility has allowed me to pull off a diverse array of projects of all shapes and sizes.

list.heading: Web development
list.cover_description: With exposure to modern fullstack web technologies and experience working on web projects of all scales and complexities, I'm ready to tackle any challenge thrown my way. üëä
list.description:
My college courses and projects have equipped me with a solid foundation of modern fullstack web technologies like Node.js, Express, and React. Overall, I've thoroughly enjoyed building robust and scalable web applications with these tools, and I'm always looking to expand my knowledge base.
That being said, many of my personal projects thrive on the simplicity and elegance of vanilla web technologies and GitHub Pages. For (smaller) personal projects, I've found that they're quick to set up and, best of all, cost nothing to publish and show off to the world! :D
This portfolio was made with vanilla HTML/CSS, JavaScript, and a sprinkle of Bootstrap for a responsive design. ‚ú®

list.heading: Mobile development
list.cover_description: As a passionate Apple fan, I've devoted a significant amount of my free time learning about iOS and, more recently, getting the hang of iOS app and tweak development.
list.description:
I've always been fascinated by user-friendly software, a passion that led me to iOS development. Along the way, I created various mini-projects to learn iOS frameworks and guidelines. One of my coolest project to date is "DontEatMyContent," a tweak for the iOS YouTube app which prevents display cutouts from interfering with videos for a better viewing experience.

I also explored Android app development in a college course, creating "BCExplorer," an app showcasing must-see attractions in British Columbia.

list.heading: Database programming
list.cover_description: Why did the database engineer leave his wife?
list.description:
"She had one-to-many relationships." ü•Å
My academic journey equipped me with a solid understanding of both relational (MySQL, PostgreSQL) and non-relational (MongoDB) database systems. This foundation allows me to design efficient schemas, optimize complex queries, and leverage the flexibility of NoSQL models for specific project needs.

list.heading: Automation & scripting
list.cover_description: Command-line tools are GOATed üêê ‚Äì unassuming in appearance but highly effective at getting the job done without unnecessary frills.
list.description: Shell scripting became a valuable tool in my toolkit in my software development journey. I've used it for a variety of things, from automating tasks, compiling and packaging C code into iOS tweaks, to tinkering with system services. Its versatility and compatibility with Unix-based systems make it the ideal solution for streamlining processes and automating repetitive tasks.

list.cover_description: uYou+ is a modified version of uYou (made by @MiRO92) with additional features and mainly made for non jailbroken users!

list.heading: Pairs
list.cover_description: 100 Days of Swift - Milestone Project 11 (UIKit): Card matching game.

list.heading: Today
list.cover_description: A simple and calming reminders app.

old.heading: Foxster
